climbs.name: Tennis Shoe Boogy
climbs.fa: Bill Gilson, Herb and Jan Conn

content.description: Climb up the flaring crack on the west buttress of the Meat Counter.

climbs.name: Steady Rollin
climbs.fa: Envisioned and Cleaned: Michael Madsen      FA: Mr. Chris Hirsch and Aaron Stetzer

content.description: Great Problem that has a scary mantle crux. Start low on the north face to the left of a giant boulder. Work the series of crimps into the dish like crimp. From here move up and crimp down on the little black pinch crimp right below the mantle. Adjust feet and throw for the desperate mantle which in my opinion is the crux.
content.protection: crash pads and spotter. There is a boulder at the base of this climb to your right.
content.location: northface side facing the chopping block trail

content.description: To the left of the start of Over the Radar is a large jug at 5 1/2 feet. Go straight up and over.
content.protection: Pads and maybe a spotter on the cliff to your left.

content.description:
Extraordinary problem with a not so extraordinary landing.  

  Start low on a good flat edge working left to gastons and sidepulls. Eventually the holds run out and a large span to a good jug out right awaits. From here climb around the corner to a easy slab topout.  

  Even though the landing sucks the climbing is superb. People with larger spans will find the crux span much easier (but still hard! V7 as Luke suggested). Shorter folk might just have to all out dyno to the jug or do what Chase did and use those micro crimps in between (V8 as Chase and I suggested).  

  Kudos to Luke on an awesome take down!
content.protection: Lots of pads placed in imaginative ways. At least one spot is REQUIRED!!!
content.location: The condo sized boulder that sits precariously between two cliffs.   The only boulder problem or climb that I know of on this large boulder.

content.description: Same start as Over the Radar. Start matched on the pinch, shoot right and up to a big jug, and then back left and up to the vein.

climbs.name: Pigskin
climbs.fa: Ron and Shari Yahne 1989 Ground Up

content.description: Pigskin climbs a line of huge jugs several routes downhill from the Lean Years.  The line can't be missed - these are some of the biggest chickenheads and jugs you'll ever see on granite.  An excellent first lead.
This route is a bit strenuous. At the beginning you bear hug the rock going past two black bolts and then around to the right in to a face past three more bolts to the anchors.
content.location: This route is on the south side of the meat counter on the west end. This is the route to the right of blue mascara on the right side of the dihedral.

content.description: This incredible, frightening problem has Chuck Fryberger written all over it. Located on the big boulder to the right of Pop You Up, Over the Radar starts matched on the low pinch in the middle section of the boulder. A few relatively easy right traversing moves lead to a difficult sequence at the arete. Once through the lower arete section a moderate section leads to the lip. The mantle is a scary 15 feet off the ground and is one of the most difficult in the Black Hills. I personally got scared off of it a few times before a successful attempt. No move is harder than V6 but they add up. Just saw its second and third ascents. Super classic!!!
content.protection: As many pads as you can get and at least one spotter.
content.location: If you are facing Pop You Up, this boulder is to your right and is around the corner on the front of the large face.

content.description: Start atop the boulder that is immediately left of Goat Skin. As you are facing the huge chockstone at the top of the chasm, Goat Skin is the second bolted climb on the left wall (the first route, closest to the chockstone is Lean Years). From the boulder, climb the water groove to the top of the formation. Step right to the Goat Skin anchor. This can be easily top roped after doing Goat Skin.
content.protection: No real  protection on the route; use the fixed anchor atop Goat Skin as a TR anchor and for rappel. A 50m rope works as a TR and rappel.
content.location: Start atop the boulder that is immediately left of Goat Skin. As you are facing the huge chockstone at the top of the chasm, Goat Skin is the second bolted climb on the left wall (the first route, closest to the chockstone is Lean Years).

content.description: A fun trad route for all. Climb the crack situated between Blue Mascara & Pop You Up. Neat stemming and jamming up an overhanging corner. Fingers to off width plus plenty of wild face holds. Great protection in good rock.
content.protection: Set of cams from .5" to 6" with doubles for 2" to 5"; a bunch of over the shoulder slings. Use the anchors for "Blue Mascara" to descend.

content.description: Lean Years is the first route just to the left of the large boulder.  It is a good lesson in delicate face climbing.  The holds are small, and a sneeze or a light breeze could knock you off.  Getting off the ground is the crux.  Some call the first move 5.11d, but it is basically just a boulder problem start at V3/V4.  Try this to improve your footwork, as the angle is very low.
content.protection: 5 quickdraws for bolts.  Fixed anchors.  The route is very short and well protected.

content.description:
Just like the classic cheese burger, the only difference is whats in the middle... 

   Starting on All You Can Eat, follow the obvious crack that diagonals up and to the right until you encounter the bolt line of Blue Mascara. Stay left of the flake and gain the face finishing on Blue Mascara.
content.protection: Bolts, standard rack up to BD .75, small cams will come in handy.
content.location: Start on All You Can Eat and finish on Blue Mascara.

climbs.name: Goat Skin
climbs.fa: Ron and Shari Yahne-1990 Ground Up

content.description: this route starts right next to the lean yearsfun short 5.7 follow bolts left to chains.someone took the registry from the summit

climbs.name: Foreskin
climbs.fa: Shari Yahne, Todd Van Alstyne-1989 Ground Up

content.description: route to the right of Pigskin.  Shares the anchors with Pigskin.

climbs.name: Dermatitis
climbs.fa: Ron and Greg Yahne, Jack Hurd-1991 Ground up

content.description: The hardest part is pulling over the bulge at the top, otherwise very easy crystal climbing.
content.protection: 2 bolts, no anchors at the top, you have to use the outdated anchors at Goat Skin.
content.location: About 8 feet East of the boulder below Goat Skin on the hill, not the best belay.

content.description: the climb is pretty self explanatory and is a great climb. The crux is about in the middle and the spine that runs of to the right is awesome.
content.protection: Quickdraws, and maybe a sling for the top, there are two closed shut anchors at the top.
content.location: Starts just left of Marv's Loss at west end of the Southeast face. Climb staying left of the crack, going directly to the top when the crack takes off right.

climbs.name: All You Can Eat
climbs.fa: Burt Lindquist, Jerry Wingenter, Dave Rone

content.description: All You Can Eat is 20' left of Blue Mascara.  The route is gently overhanging up to, and through the crux.  Four bolts protect the lower moves and crux, a #9 stopper protects the last 20'.  A little pumpy, lots of fun!
content.protection: Four bolts, take a #9 stopper to protect upper moves.  Two-bolt rappel/belay anchor on top.

content.description: Meat Counter has a lot of good moderates in a concentrated area.  Popular routes range from 5.5 to 5.12, and are all high quality.  Many routes are really short.  A one rope rappel is always plenty.  Routes are mostly bolted face climbs.
